model_json module¶

A Model part of the bookmark manager. This version creates an internal tree of node objects. The bookmark tree is stored into a file in the json format. Methods of ModelJSON class for an interface:

class model_json.ModelJSON¶

Bases: object

Implementation of a Model module with an internal tree structure. Storing a tree database in JSON format.

add_node(attr_dict: dict, node_type: bool)¶

Add a folder or url to the tree and save the tree into the file

Parameters:

  • attr_dict – dictionary with initial node attributes

  • node_type – True for folder adding, False for url

Returns:

nothing

convert_chrome(filename: str) → tuple[bool, str]¶

Convert Chrome bookmark JSON filename to the current tree. Return (True/False, error message)

Parameters:

filename – Google bookmark filename to convert

Returns:

(True, empty string) or (False, error message)

convert_mozilla(filename: str) → tuple[bool, str]¶

Convert Mozilla bookmark filename to the current tree. Return (True/False, error message).

Parameters:

filename – Mozilla bookmark filename to convert

Returns:

(True, empty string) or (False, error message)

create_database(name: str)¶

Create an empty bookmark structure and a file to keep the database.

Exceptions:

FileExistsError if given filename exists

Parameters:

name – name and filename of the new database

Returns:

nothing

delete_database(name: str)¶

Delete the database file.

Exception:

FileNotFoundError if the filename does not exist

Parameters:

name – name and filename of the deleting database

Returns:

True if success otherwise False

delete_node(name: str)¶

Delete a node from the current tree.

Raises:

  • NodeNotExists – if node_name does not exist

  • FolderNotEmpty – if node_name folder is not empty

Parameters:

name – node name to delete

Returns:

nothing

get_children(node_name: str) → tuple[bool, tuple[str, ...]]¶

Get a list of child names of the node.

Exceptions:

NodeNotExists if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

node_name – name of a node

Returns:

True/False, tuple of child’s names/empty tuple

get_node(name: str) → dict¶

Get a node content. Replace children objects with their names for folder children list

Exceptions:

raise NodeNotExists if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

name – node name

Returns:

dictionary {field_name: field_value} of the node

open_database(name: str)¶

Open a database, read and extract it into a bookmark tree.

Exception:

FileNotFoundError if the filename does not exist

Parameters:

name – name and filename of the deleting database

Returns:

nothing

update_node(name: str, attr_dict: dict)¶

Update a folder or url of the internal tree and save it into the file

Parameters:

  • name – updating node name

  • attr_dict – dictionary with the updating fields

Returns:

nothing

class model_json.MyJSONEncoder(*, skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, default=None)¶

Bases: JSONEncoder

Overwrite the default JSON encoder class from the json module

default(obj: Folder | Url | RootBookmarks)¶

Customize the encoding of the following custom classes: Root Bookmarks, Folder, Url.

Parameters:

obj – a tree object that is being serialized

Returns:

a dictionary of the input object to encode by json.py
